original_title: Fixing Some More of Apple’s Design Mistakes
original_content:
Love them or hate them, theres no denying that Apple has strayed from the Wozs original open platform ideal for the Apple II. [Ken Pillonel] is back for another round of fixing Apples repairability mistakes with a full complement of 3D printable replacement parts for the AirPods Pro case.
While modeling all of the parts would be handy enough for repairing a device with a 0/10 iFixit score, [Pillonel] modified the parts to go together with screws instead of adhesive so any future repairs dont require cracking the plastic egg. He says, By showcasing the potential for repairability, I hope to inspire both consumers and multi-billion dollar companies, like Apple, to embrace sustainable practices in their products.
[Pillonel]s repairability exploits may seem familiar to readers from his previous work on adding USB-C to the iPhone and the AirPods Pro case. If you just need to retrieve a lost AirPod, you might try an electromagnet, or you can make a Bluetooth receiver from a pair of knock-off buds.
title: Apple IIのオープンプラットフォームアイデアを修正するためのAirPods Proケースの3Dプリント部品
body: アップルはオープンプラットフォームのアイデアから逸脱していますが、[Pillonel]さんはAirPods Proケースの3Dプリント可能なパーツで修理をサポートします。修理性を示すことで、消費者やアップルなどの大企業に持続可能な製品を取り入れるようにインスパイアしたいと述べています。
